description.narrative:
Sedan Parisavtalet undertecknades 2015 har 195 länder inlett ansträngningar för att sätta upp klimatmål för växthusgaser (GHG) och följa genomförandet av åtgärder för att mildra klimatförändringarna.
För att ta itu med de långsiktiga internationella målen för mer kostnadseffektiva åtgärder för att begränsa utsläpp baserat på regeringarnas nationellt bestämda bidrag (NDC) är det mycket viktigt för länder att inrätta en omfattande och systematisk process för övervakning, rapportering och verifiering (MRV) av GHG-utsläpp och kolsänkor på ett transparent sätt.
MRV-system är en mekanism som kan lösa problem med otillräckliga data och otillräcklig kapacitet. Att skapa en robust MRV-mekanism kräver betydande ansträngning. Global Green Growth Institut (GGGI) lanserade sitt MRV-program i maj 2017 i avsikt att stötta prioriterade länder att etablera MRV-system som underlättar utsläppsminskningar och kan locka till gröna investeringar. Projekt har under 2017-2018 genomförts i t.ex Lao PDR, Myanmar, Mongoliet och Uganda.
Burkina Fasos anslutning till GGGI röstades igenom 2018 och ger mandat till GGGI att stödja landet i övergången till en grön tillväxt som är stark, hållbar och inkluderande. Detta inkluderar en rad initiativ för att stödja Burkina Faso, inklusive detta projekt med målsättningarna: i) Uppnå ett systematiskt, integrerat och robust GHG-datasystem för att stärka, harmonisera och integrera nationella åtgärder för att begränsa utsläppen och ii) förbereda Burkina Faso på de strängare rapporteringskraven i Parisavtalet.
Utvecklingen av Burkina Fasos MRV-system har två mål: 1) uppnå ett systematiskt, integrerat och robust GHG-datasystem för att stärka, harmonisera och integrera nationella åtgärder för att begränsa utsläppen av GHG-gaser och 2) förbereda Burkina Faso för de strängare rapporteringskraven i Parisavtalet
De viktigaste resultaten och resultaten som förväntas från MRV-projektet i Burkina Faso är:
Resultat 1: Etablerat nationellt MRV-system som gör det möjligt för landet att uppfylla sina skyldigheter inom ramarna för förbättrad insyn i Parisavtalet, identifiera områden för begränsning och anpassning för att underlätta gröna investeringar. Detta inkluderar förankrade institutionella arrangemang och avtal för datadelning som är nödvändiga för att uppfylla landets skyldigheter enligt FN:s klimatkonvention UNFCCC och Parisavtalet. Detta gör det också möjligt för landet att mäta indikatorer som kan bidra till att uppnå FN:s hållbarhetsmål (SDGs).
Resultat 2: Förbättrad nationell kapacitet för exakta GHG-inventeringar och förhandlingar om frågor som rör transparens. Dessa inkluderar att identifiera lämpliga MRV-krav för att bedöma kapacitetsutvecklingsbehov, identifiera nödvändig klimatfinansiering och noggrant mäta, rapportera och verifiera Burkina Fasos genomförande av åtaganden angående utsläppsminskningar (NDCs).
Den begärda budgeten för treårsperioden är 1 701 453 USD (cirka 16 500 000 SEK).

Since the Paris Agreement was signed in 2015, 195 countries have begun to make concerted efforts to set greenhouse gas (GHG) mitigation targets and track the implementation of actions to mitigate climate change.
To address the long-term international goals for more cost-effective mitigation activities based on governments’ Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs), it is highly significant for countries to institute a comprehensive and systematic process of monitoring, reporting and verification (MRV) of GHG emissions and sinks in a transparent way. MRV systems are recognized as a mechanism that can resolve challenges that result from insufficient data and inadequate capacity. Setting up a robust MRV mechanism requires considerable effort.
The Global Green Growth Insitute (GGGI) launched its MRV program in May 2017 to enable priority countries to establish MRV systems that track their performance in implementing mitigation actions and attracting green investment. Activities have during 2017-2018 been carried out in e.g. Lao PDR, Myanmar, Mongolia and Uganda.
Burkina Faso's accession to GGGI was voted in 2018, with a mandate from GGGI to support the country into its transition in a green growth that is strong, sustainable and inclusive. This includes a range of initiatives to support Burkina Faso, including this project with the objectives: i) Achieve a systematic, integrated, and robust GHG data system to strengthen, harmonize, and mainstream national mitigation policies and targets; and ii) Prepare for higher, more stringent reporting requirements of the Paris Agreement.
The development of Burkina Faso’s MRV system has two objectives: 1) achieve a systematic, integrated, and robust GHG data system to strengthen, harmonize, and mainstream national mitigation policies and targets; and 2) prepare for higher, more stringent reporting requirements of the Paris Agreement
The key results and outcomes expected from the overall MRV project in Burkina Faso are:
Outcome 1: Established national MRV system enabling the country to meet its obligations under the enhanced transparency framework of the Paris Agreement, identify mitigation and adaptation areas to facilitate leveraging green investment. This includes entrenched institutional arrangements and agreements for data sharing necessary to meet the country’s obligations under the UNFCCC and Paris Agreement. This will also enable the country to measure and monitor indicators that can contribute to achieving the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals.
Outcome 2: Enhanced country-capacity to prepare accurate GHG inventories and to negotiate on issues related to transparency. These include identifying the appropriate MRV requirements for assessing its capacity development needs, identifying the required climate finance needed, and accurately measuring, reporting, and verifying Burkina Faso's implementation of its national emission commitments (NDCs).
The requested budget for the three-year period is 1 701 453 USD (approximately 16 500 000 SEK).

The development objective of the project is that Burkina Faso has increased capacity and ability to meet its MRV obligations under the UNFCCC and enhanced transparency requirements under the Paris Agreement, and is better equipped in the transparency negotiations, increasing Burkina Fasos stature in the international community whereby Burkina Faso can identify its major GHG emitting sectors completely and comprehensively. The project has two immediate objectives: 1) Achieve a systematic, integrated and robust GHG data system to strengthen, harmonize and mainstream national mitigation policies and targets; 2) Prepare for higher, more stringent reporting requirements of the Paris Agreement under the United Nations Climate Convention. Project Components consist of a) an established national MRV system and b) an enhanced capacity for GHG inventory and reporting.

description.narrative: Key expected results during 2021 - expected as well as unexpected - listed below: - Development of a national interactive digital platform for Burkina Faso's MRV-system - Analysis of data gaps for complete inventories in the energy and industrial process sectors. Recommendations on how to address data gaps have been developed - Inventory tests have been carried out of the national IGES MRV-guide during 2021 - The regulatory and legal framework for the sharing of MRV data between stakeholders in Burkina Faso has been assessed - A review has been conducted of existing laws and regulations, on the sharing of MRV data for the four inventory sectors (i.e. energy, industrial processes, agriculture / forestry / land use and waste) - Analysis of international "best practices" conducted for the legal and institutional framework of national MRV-systems - Research study realised on the development of specific emission factors in the energy sector - Capacity development of 212 national stakeholders on the collection and analysis of mobile data within numerous themes and areas (for example the use of Kobo tools; estimation of the carbon footprint using EX-ACT; case studies of greenhouse gas inventories in the energy and industrial process sectors; geographic information systems (GIS) and the processing of satellite images for land use analysis; integration of climate change into national development planning (PNDES II); performance-based management and climate diplomacy with associated mechanisms and tools) - During the implementation of capacity building activities GGGI has noted the project need to further strenghten the possibility for women to actively participate in consultation with stakeholders in order to enhance their leadership. - Coordination in the implementation of project activities, in particular the coherent development of the capacity development plan with the key actors (i.e. DGEVCC, SP / CNDD and INSD), was a success factor during 2021 - GGGI has also learned that state actors appreciate in the consistent work with different GGGI projects and synergies between GGGI's projects are appreciated. It was noted during 2021 that the MRV-system will assist in addressing and solving serveral problems related to climate transparency and data availability. - GGGI believes that state agents are ready to take responsibility for the MRV system at the end of 2022. The technical contribution from these key stakeholders has been extensive during, among other things, the development of the digital MRV platform. - ONDD and the Ministry of the Digital Economy have been strongly involved during the implementation of the contributon and it is public authority ONDD, with the technical department within SP / CNDD, which will administer the digital platform for the MRV system
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
